headline: How Should Investors Value Huntington Ingalls After 52% Gain and New Government Contracts in 2025?
summary: Trying to decide what to do with Huntington Ingalls Industries stock right now? You are not alone. After all, this defense and shipbuilding powerhouse closed recently at $285.77, and its share price has been anything but stagnant this year. While the last week saw a modest dip of -2.1%, zoom out just a bit and you will see a different story. Over the past month shares are up 3.9%, year-to-date gains stand at a remarkable 52.3%, and the stock has more than doubled, rising 118.8%, over the past...

headline: A Fresh Look at Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII) Valuation After Recent Modest Share Price Gains
summary: Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII) has seen its stock edge up slightly over the past day, trading just above $285. Recent month returns show a gradual climb, inviting investors to consider recent results along with long-term prospects. See our latest analysis for Huntington Ingalls Industries. Momentum has picked up for Huntington Ingalls Industries over the past year, with a robust share price return of more than 52% year-to-date. headline: Lockheed Martin (LMT) Beats Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Lockheed (LMT) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +9.79% and +0.28%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: HII Increases Quarterly Dividend to $1.38 per Share
summary: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Oct. 21, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- HII (NYSE: HII) announced today that its Board of Directors has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $1.38 per share, a $0.03 increase over the $1.35 per share dividend paid in each of the prior four quarters. The $1.38 per share dividend will be payable on Dec. 12, 2025, to shareholders of record as of the close of business on Nov. 28, 2025. About HII HII is a global, all-domain defense provider. headline: The Bull Case For Huntington Ingalls (HII) Could Change Following Virginia-Class Submarine Sea Trials and Hyundai Talks
summary: Earlier this month, Huntington Ingalls Industries announced its Newport News Shipbuilding division had completed initial sea trials for the Virginia-class attack submarine Massachusetts (SSN 798), following testing of key systems at sea ahead of delivery to the U.S. Navy. HII also welcomed leaders from HD Hyundai Heavy Industries for multi-day discussions on shipbuilding technology and manufacturing processes, highlighting a commitment to collaboration and advancing global defense...

headline: Huntington Ingalls: Policy Support Continues With AUKUS Commitment (Upgrade)
